sections.heading: This Act may be cited as the Food Safety Transportation Act.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Food Safety Transportation Act.

sections.heading: The purpose of this Act is to protect, promote and preserve
sections.text:
the public health and general welfare by providing for the establishment
and enforcement of minimum standards for the safe and sanitary
transportation of food intended for human consumption.

sections.heading: (a) It shall be unlawful for any carrier which provides
sections.text:
transportation in intrastate commerce by motor vehicle to transport food,
drugs, devices or cosmetics as defined in Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.5 and 2.6 of
the Illinois Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, or food packaging, in any motor
vehicle that has, within 2 years before transporting food, drugs, devices,
or cosmetics, transported a substance which would render a food adulterated
within the meaning of Section 10 of the Illinois Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.

sections.heading: Any person who violates this Act shall be guilty of a business
sections.text: offense and fined a sum of not less than $1,000 nor more than $2,500.

sections.heading: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
